executiveSummary: William and Kristen, co-founders of Uprising Food from Cincinnati, Ohio, pitched their keto, paleo, and gluten-free bread and chips brand to the Sharks, seeking $500,000 for 3% equity. Despite strong revenue growth and a compelling health mission, all Sharks declined to invest due to the high price point, lack of profitability, and unclear path to sustainable margins.

actionItems.task: Simplify and focus the sales pitch to emphasize the unique value of the bread (taste, health benefits, freshness) rather than jargon or valuation metrics.
Re-evaluate pricing and profitability strategy to establish a clear path to profitability.
Optimize customer acquisition costs and improve unit economics.

nextSteps: The founders will continue operating Uprising Food independently, refining their product positioning, pricing, and marketing strategy without Shark investment.
